sen.j: 平城宮（へいじょうきゅう）は奈良の古都平城京の大内裏。
sen.e: Heijo-kyu Palace was Dai-dairi (the place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) of an ancient capital Heijokyo in Nara.
Heijo-kyu Palace was Dai-dairi (the place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) of an ancient capital Heijo-kyo in Nara.
sen.cmt: Heijo-kyo とハイフンを追加しました。
sen.e: Heijo-kyu Palace was Dai-dairi (the place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) of an ancient capital Heijo-kyo in Nara.

sen.j: 1998年12月、「古都奈良の文化財」として東大寺などと共に世界文化遺産に登録された（考古遺跡としては日本初）。
sen.e: In December, 1998, Heijo-kyu Place was registered as one of the World Heritage under the name of 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara' together with Todaiji Temple (the first registered ancient remains).

In December, 1998, Heijo-kyu Palace was registered as one of the World Heritage under the name of 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara' together with Todai-ji Temple (the first registered ancient remains in Japan).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: In December, 1998, Heijo-kyu Palace was registered as one of the World Heritage under the name of 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara' together with Todai-ji Temple (the first registered ancient remains in Japan).

sen.j: 平城京の北端に置かれ、天皇の住まいである内裏と、儀式を行う朝堂院、役人が執務を行う官庁から成り、約120haを占めていた。
sen.e: Heijo-kyu Palace was situated at the north end of Heijokyo, consisting of Dairi (Imperial Palace), Chodo-in where ceremonies were performed, and offices where officials carried out their work, and it covered an area of about 120 ha.

Heijo-kyu Palace was situated at the north end of Heijo-kyo, consisting of Dairi (Imperial Palace), Chodo-in where ceremonies were performed, and offices where officials carried out their work, covering an area of about 120 ha.
sen.cmt: Heijo-kyo とハイフンを追加しました。
sen.e: Heijo-kyu Palace was situated at the north end of Heijo-kyo, consisting of Dairi (Imperial Palace), Chodo-in where ceremonies were performed, and offices where officials carried out their work, covering an area of about 120 ha.

sen.j: 周囲は5ｍ程度の大垣が張り巡らされ、朱雀門はじめ豪族の氏名にちなんだ12の門が設置され役人らはそれらの門より出入りした。
sen.e: The Palace was surrounded by big tsujibei (a mud wall with a roof) about five meters high, and the wall had twelve gates named after local ruling families names such as Suzaku-mon Gate, and government officials entered the Palace through the gates.

The Palace was surrounded by big tsujibei (a mud wall with a roof) about five meters high, and the wall had twelve gates named after local ruling families names such as Suzaku-mon Gate, and government officials entered the Palace through the gates.

The Palace was surrounded by big tsujibei (a mud wall with a roof) about five meters high, and the wall had twelve gates named after local ruling families names such as Suzaku-mon Gate, and government officials entered the Palace through the gates.

sen.j: 東端には、東院庭園がおかれ、宴などが催された。
sen.e: At the east end, Toin Teien Gargen was situated, where parties and events were held.
At the east end, Toin Teien Gargen was situated, where parties and events were held.
At the east end, Toin Teien Gargen was situated, where parties and events were held.

sen.j: また、この東院庭園は今日の日本庭園の原型とされている。
sen.e: Toin Teien Garden is regarded as a prototype of today's Japanese gardens.
Toin Teien Garden is regarded as a prototype of today's Japanese gardens.
Toin Teien Garden is regarded as a prototype of today's Japanese gardens.

sen.j: 794年の平安京遷都後は放棄され、農地となっていた。
sen.e: After the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo in 794, the place was abandoned and used as agricultural land.
After the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo in 794, the place was abandoned and used as agricultural land.
After the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo in 794, the place was abandoned and used as agricultural land.

sen.j: 1852年（文政8年）、奉行所の役人であった北浦定政が『平城宮大内裏跡坪割之図』を著し、平城京の跡地を推定した。
sen.e: In 1852, a government official at the magistrate's office Sadamasa KITAURA estimated the site of Heijo-kyo by drawing "Heijokyu daidairi ato tsubowari no zu" (Heijo-kyu Palace Dai-dairi site zoning map).
sen.cmt: http://www.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kotenseki/html/ru11/ru11_01175/index.html"Heijokyu daidairi ato tsubowari no zu"表記＆現物あり。よって"-"なし。
sen.e: In 1852, a government official at the magistrate's office Sadamasa KITAURA estimated the site of Heijo-kyo by drawing "Heijokyu daidairi ato tsubowari no zu" (Heijo-kyu Palace Dai-dairi site zoning map).

In 1852, a government official at the magistrate's office Sadamasa KITAURA estimated the site of Heijo-kyo by drawing "Heijokyu daidairi ato tsubowari no zu" (Heijo-kyu Palace Dai-dairi site zoning map).

sen.j: 明治時代に建築史家、関野貞が田んぼの中にある小高い芝地が大極殿（第二次）の基壇であることを発見、1907年『平城京及大内裏考』を奈良新聞に発表した。
sen.e: During the Meiji Period, an architectural historian Tadashi SEKINO discovered a grassy mound in the rice paddies to be a stylobate for Daigokuden (the Imperial Audience Hall) (latter), and published "Heijo-kyo oyobi dai-dairi ko" (A Study of Heijo-kyo and Dai-dairi) in Nara Newspaper in 1907.
sen.cmt: http://porta.ndl.go.jp/service/servlet/Result_Detail?meta_item_no=I000123983&meta_repository_no=R000000008上記サイトで『平城京及大内裏考』の読み確認しました。
sen.e: During the Meiji period, an architectural historian Tadashi SEKINO discovered a grassy mound in the rice paddies to be a stylobate for Daigokuden (the Imperial Audience Hall) (latter), and published "Heijo-kyo oyobi dai-dairi ko" (A Study of Heijo-kyo and Dai-dairi) in Nara Newspaper in 1907.
sen.cmt: period を小文字にしました。
sen.e: During the Meiji period, an architectural historian Tadashi SEKINO discovered a grassy mound in the rice paddies to be a stylobate for Daigokuden (the Imperial Audience Hall) (latter), and published "Heijo-kyo oyobi dai-dairi ko" (A Study of Heijo-kyo and Dai-dairi) in Nara Newspaper in 1907.

sen.j: この研究記事がきっかけとなり、棚田嘉十郎・溝辺文四郎らが中心となり平城宮跡の保存の運動が起こった。
sen.e: This study article brought a movement of preserving the Heijo-kyu Palace Site that was mainly directed by Kajuro TANADA, Bunshiro MIZOBE, and others.
This study article brought a movement of preserving the Heijo-kyu Palace Site that was mainly directed by Kajuro TANADA, Bunshiro MIZOBE, and others.
This study article brought a movement of preserving the Heijo-kyu Palace Site that was mainly directed by Kajuro TANADA, Bunshiro MIZOBE, and others.

sen.j: 1921年には、平城宮跡の中心部分が民間の寄金によって買い取られ、国に寄付された。
sen.e: In 1921, the central part of the Heijo-kyu Palace Site was purchased by private donations and entrusted to the government.
In 1921, the central part of the Heijo-kyu Palace Site was purchased by private donations and entrusted to the government.
In 1921, the central part of the Heijo-kyu Palace Site was purchased by private donations and entrusted to the government.

sen.j: その後、平城宮址（へいじょうきゅうし）は1922年に国の史跡に指定された（後に特別史跡）。
sen.e: After that, in 1922, the Heijo-kyu Palace Site was designated as a national historic site (later a special historic site).
After that, in 1922, "Heijo-kyu shi" (平城宮址, meaning the Heijo-kyu Palace Site) was designated as a national historic site (later a special historic site).
sen.cmt: 後に漢字の変更について述べられているため、こちらで旧字を追記しました。
sen.e: After that, in 1922, "Heijo-kyu shi" (平城宮址, meaning the Heijo-kyu Palace Site) was designated as a national historic site (later a special historic site).

sen.j: 1960年代に私鉄電車の検車庫問題と国道建設問題に対する二度の国民的保存運動がおこった。
sen.e: In 1960s, two national preservation movements arose against the private railway company's train inspection garage problem and also the national route construction problem.
In 1960s, two national preservation movements arose against the private railway company's train inspection garage problem and also the national route construction problem.
In 1960s, two national preservation movements arose against the private railway company's train inspection garage problem and also the national route construction problem.

sen.j: 現在は、ほぼ本来の平城宮跡地が指定され保存されている。
sen.e: At present, the almost original Heijo-kyu Palace Site is specified and being preserved.
At present, the almost original Heijo-kyu Palace Site is specified and being preserved.
At present, the almost original Heijo-kyu Palace Site is specified and being preserved.

sen.j: のちに址（し・あと）が常用漢字外であるため平城宮跡（へいじょうきゅうせき）と書かれるようになる。
sen.e: Later, the Heijo-kyu Palace Site was renamed and described as "Heijo-kyu seki" since the character "址" ('shi' or 'ato') is out of kanji for common use (a list of 1945 kanji established in 1981).

Later, the name of the Site was changed to "Heijo-kyu seki" (平城宮跡) since the character "址" ('shi' or 'ato') in "Heijo-kyu shi" (平城宮址) was out of kanji for common use (a list of 1945 kanji established in 1981).
sen.cmt: 漢字の違いが分かるように漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: Later, the name of the Site was changed to "Heijo-kyu seki" (平城宮跡) since the character "址" ('shi' or 'ato') in "Heijo-kyu shi" (平城宮址) was out of kanji for common use (a list of 1945 kanji established in 1981).

sen.j: なお、唐招提寺の講堂（国宝）は平城宮朝堂院にあった建物の一つである東朝集殿を移築したものである。
sen.e: The Kodo Hall of Toshodai-ji Temple (National Treasure) is Higashi Choshuden (government workers' building), a relocated building from Chodo-in in Heijo-kyu Palace.
The Kodo Hall of Toshodai-ji Temple (a National Treasure) is the Higashi Choshuden (government workers' building), one of the relocated buildings from Chodo-in in Heijo-kyu Palace.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。
sen.e: The Kodo Hall of Toshodai-ji Temple (a National Treasure) is the Higashi Choshuden (government workers' building), one of the relocated buildings from Chodo-in in Heijo-kyu Palace.

sen.j: 切妻造を入母屋にしたり、鎌倉時代の様式で改造されている箇所もあるが、平城宮唯一の建築遺構として貴重である。
sen.e: Some parts have been rebuilt in the style of the Kamakura Period as changed from the Kirizuma-zukuri style to the Irimoya style, but the building is still precious as the only ancient structural remnants of Heijo-kyu Palace.

Some parts have been rebuilt in the style of the Kamakura period as changed from the Kirizuma-zukuri style (a style of building with a gable roof) to the Irimoya style (a style of building with a half-hipped roof), but the building is still precious as the only ancient structural remnants of Heijo-kyu Palace.
sen.cmt: 入母屋、切妻 を補足しました。
sen.e: Some parts have been rebuilt in the style of the Kamakura period as changed from the Kirizuma-zukuri style (a style of building with a gable roof) to the Irimoya style (a style of building with a half-hipped roof), but the building is still precious as the only ancient structural remnants of Heijo-kyu Palace.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 文化庁による「特別史跡平城宮跡保存整備基本構想」に基づき、遺跡の整備・建造物の復原を進めている。
sen.e: Maintenance of the remains and restoration of the buildings are in progress based on 'Tokubetsu shiseki heijokyuseki hozon seibi kihon kousou' (Special Historic Site Heijo-kyu Site Preservation and Maintenance Project) settled on the Agency for Cultural Affairs.
sen.cmt: 「特別史跡平城宮跡保存整備基本構想」の対訳が分かりませんでしたので、括弧にいれて英訳しています。
sen.e: Maintenance of the remains and restoration of the buildings are in progress based on 'Tokubetsu shiseki heijokyuseki hozon seibi kihon koso' (Special Historic Site Heijo-kyu Site Preservation and Maintenance Project) settled by the Agency for Cultural Affairs.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Maintenance of the remains and restoration of the buildings are in progress based on 'Tokubetsu shiseki heijokyuseki hozon seibi kihon koso' (Special Historic Site Heijo-kyu Site Preservation and Maintenance Project) settled by the Agency for Cultural Affairs.

sen.j: すでに朱雀門（1998年竣工）・宮内省地区・東院庭園地区の復原が完了しており、もっとも重要な建物である大極殿（第一次）の復原が2010年の完成を目指して進められている。
sen.e: Already restored are Suzaku-mon Gate (construction completed in 1998), the district of Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household), and the district of Toin Teien Garden, and the most important building Daigokuden (former) is now being restored for completion in 2010.

Already restored are Suzaku-mon Gate (construction completed in 1998), the district of Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household), and the district of Toin Teien Garden, and Daigokuden (former), which is the most important building, is now being restored for completion in 2010.
sen.cmt: 一部語順を変更しました。
sen.e: Already restored are Suzaku-mon Gate (construction completed in 1998), the district of Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household), and the district of Toin Teien Garden, and Daigokuden (former), which is the most important building, is now being restored for completion in 2010.

sen.j: また、敷地内を横切る近鉄奈良線と奈良県道104号谷田奈良線（一条大路）は移設が検討されている。
sen.e: Also, Kintetsu Nara Line and Nara Prefectural Road 104, Tanida Nara Line (Ichijo-oji Street), which are passing across the Site, are being examined for relocation.
Also, Kintetsu Nara Line and Tanida Nara Line of the Nara Prefectural Route 104 (Ichijo-oji Street), both of which pass across the Site, are being examined for relocation.
sen.cmt: Road →Route としました。Are passing→ pass としました。
sen.e: Also, Kintetsu Nara Line and Tanida Nara Line of the Nara Prefectural Route 104 (Ichijo-oji Street), both of which pass across the Site, are being examined for relocation.

sen.j: とくに近鉄奈良線については大和西大寺駅、新大宮駅とともに地下化される可能性もある。
sen.e: Kintetsu Nara Line, however, could be an underground line, involving Yamato-Saidaiji Station and Shin-Omiya Station.
Kintetsu Nara Line, however, could be an underground line, involving Yamato-Saidaiji Station and Shin-Omiya Station.
Kintetsu Nara Line, however, could be an underground line, involving Yamato-Saidaiji Station and Shin-Omiya Station.

sen.j: なお、整備計画区域内の朱雀門南西側には積水化学工業奈良工場がある。
sen.e: Besides, to the southwest of the maintenance project area, Sekisui Chemical Company Nara Plant is situated.
Besides, to the southwest of the Suzaku-mon Gate within the maintenance project area, Sekisui Chemical Company Nara Plant is situated.
sen.cmt: 朱雀門 を追加しました。
sen.e: Besides, to the southwest of the Suzaku-mon Gate within the maintenance project area, Sekisui Chemical Company Nara Plant is situated.

sen.j: 敷地の一部が朱雀大路跡地にかかっているため、奈良市が約24億円を投じて移転用地を確保したものの、2000年1月に同社から業績の悪化を理由に移転断念の申し入れがあり、翌2月に移転断念が決まった。
sen.e: Part of its premises is on the Suzaku-oji Street Site, so Nara City spent about 2.4 billion yen for a relocation site, but in January, 2000, Sekisui Chemical suggested abandoning the relocation plan for a decrease in its profit, and it was decided in February, 2001.

Since part of its premises is on the Suzaku-oji Street Site, Nara City spent about 2.4 billion yen to secure a relocation site, but in January, 2000, Sekisui Chemical suggested abandoning the relocation plan due to a decrease in its profit, whose decision was finalized in February, 2001.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Since part of its premises is on the Suzaku-oji Street Site, Nara City spent about 2.4 billion yen to secure a relocation site, but in January, 2000, Sekisui Chemical suggested abandoning the relocation plan due to a decrease in its profit, whose decision was finalized in February, 2001.

sen.j: 最近になって再び移転構想が出てきているが、まだ具体化には至っていない。
sen.e: The relocation plan has been recently revitalized but not embodied yet.
The relocation plan has been recently revitalized again, but not embodied yet.
The relocation plan has been recently revitalized again, but not embodied yet.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 朱雀門 - 復元朱雀門。
sen.e: Suzaku-mon Gate: Suzaku-mon Gate restored
Suzaku-mon Gate: Suzaku-mon Gate restored
Suzaku-mon Gate: Suzaku-mon Gate restored

sen.j: 朱雀大路広場
sen.e: Suzaku-oji Street open space
Suzaku-oji Street open space
Suzaku-oji Street open space

sen.j: 棚田嘉十郎銅像
sen.e: Kajuro TANADA bronze statue
Kajuro TANADA bronze statue
Kajuro TANADA bronze statue

sen.j: 兵部省 ・式部省- 基壇・礎石が復元されている。
sen.e: Hyobusho (the Ministry of Military) and Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial): The stylobates and foundation stones are restored.
Hyobusho (the Ministry of Military) and Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial): The stylobates and foundation stones are restored.
Hyobusho (the Ministry of Military) and Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial): The stylobates and foundation stones are restored.

sen.j: 平城宮跡資料館 - 全体模型、大極殿院模型など。
sen.e: The Heijo Palace Site Museum: A model of the Heijo-kyu Palace Site, a model of Daigokudenin, etc.
The Heijo Palace Site Museum: A model of the Heijo-kyu Palace Site, a model of Daigokuden-in (complex of Imperial Audience Hall), etc.
sen.cmt: 大極殿院→Complex of Imperial Audience Hall と補足しました。（参考：http://www.nara.accu.or.jp/elearning/2005/designfor.pdf）
sen.e: The Heijo Palace Site Museum: A model of the Heijo-kyu Palace Site, a model of Daigokuden-in (complex of Imperial Audience Hall), etc.

sen.j: 第一次大極殿 - 復元工事中。
sen.e: The Former Imperial Audience Hall: Under restoration
The Former Imperial Audience Hall: Under restoration
The Former Imperial Audience Hall: Under restoration

sen.j: 第二次大極殿 - 基壇を復元。
sen.e: The Latter Imperial Audience Hall: The stylobates restored
The Latter Imperial Audience Hall: The stylobates restored
The Latter Imperial Audience Hall: The stylobates restored

sen.j: 遺構展示館 - 発掘された遺跡の上に建てられており、見学できる。
sen.e: The Excavation Site Exhibition Hall: Built on the excavated remains and open for visitors
The Excavation Site Exhibition Hall: Built on the excavated remains and open for visitors
The Excavation Site Exhibition Hall: Built on the excavated remains and open for visitors

sen.j: 宮内省 - 建物群、築地塀が復元されている。
sen.e: Kunaisho: Buildings and Tsuijibei Wall are restored.
Kunaisho: Buildings and tsuijibei wall are restored.
sen.cmt: 一部小文字にしました。
sen.e: Kunaisho: Buildings and tsuijibei wall are restored.

sen.j: 東院庭園 - 庭園・楼閣などが復元されている。
sen.e: Toin Teien Garden: The garden and a tower are restored.
Toin Teien Garden: The garden and a tower are restored.
Toin Teien Garden: The garden and a tower are restored.
